title: Light Size Relative to Subject
description: A quick win: understand Light Size Relative to Subject.

hook.text: The sun is enormous. But it looks tiny in our sky. That's why sunlight is hard â€” apparent size matters.

buildup.text: A light source's hardness or softness depends on its apparent size relative to the subject, not its actual size.

discovery.text: A small flash an inch from a flower is effectively a huge source. The same flash ten feet away is a harsh pinpoint.

twist.text: The sun â€” 864,000 miles wide â€” produces hard light because it's 93 million miles away. Ratio wins, not measurement.

climax.text: This one principle explains almost all lighting behavior. Size relative to subject governs everything.

punchline.text: The sun is huge. From here, it's a dot. Hard light.

quiz.question: Why does the sun produce hard light despite being enormous?
options: Its apparent size from Earth is very small relative to subjects
